means: 使习惯（于）( inure的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_cn: 医生们已经能坦然面对死亡。

sentence.Network_en: The prisoners quickly became inured to the harsh conditions.
sentence.Network_cn: 囚犯们很快就适应了苛刻的条件.

sentence.Network_en: He has inured himself to accept misfortune.
sentence.Network_cn: 他锻练了自己,使自己能承受不幸.

PerfectNetExp.abs: he had become inured to ridicule ., 他已受惯了他人的讥笑.
800 chinese flashcards | Quizlet ... inundate 漫 inured 见怪不怪 invective 漫骂的.
having rugged physical strength ; inured to fatigue or hardships ., 有强壮的体力 ; 惯于承受疲劳和艰苦.
He was inured to the cold ., 他易于患感冒.

list.abs: A decade of Japanese rule had inured Macchurians to most anything ., 经过日本人的十几年统治 , 满洲人对一切已习惯于逆来顺受.
...免费保障(free cover)四，可信度五，内嵌式再保险(inuring reinsurance)本章小结.
one cannot inure oneself altogether to such malicious criticism ., 谁也不能总是忍受这种恶意批评.
We should inure ourselves to hard life ., 我们应该使自己习惯艰苦生活.

entry.tran: 对（令人不快的事物）司空见惯的;习惯于…的
entry.def: If you are inured to something unpleasant, you have become used to it so that it no longer affects you.

example.tran: 医生们已经能坦然面对死亡。

sentences.sentence: "a peasant, dark, lean-faced, wind-inured"- Robert Lynd
"our successors...may be graver, more inured and equable men"- V.S.Pritchett

auth_sentence.content: We have become...inured to living in a state of quasi-anxiety.
auth_sentence.res_content: We have become...inured to living in a state of quasi-anxiety.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We have become...inured to living in a state of quasi-anxiety.

auth_sentence.content: Listeners quickly become inured to shouting.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Listeners quickly become inured to shouting.

auth_sentence.content: The hospital staff were sad, inured though they were to such tragedies.
auth_sentence.res_content: The hospital staff were sad, inured though they were to such tragedies.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The hospital staff were sad, inured though they were to such tragedies.

sentences.en: The prisoners quickly became inured to the harsh conditions.
sentences.cn: 囚犯们很快就适应了苛刻的条件。
